I have to compromise my values and everything I worked hard to preserve for the last few months to go out, even if I put on extra protection etc. And I just rigidly refuse to compromise my values because I don't believe it's right. Because if I had done that, I would have done that already, and long ago. And even though it's really hard on me. yeah exactly. Because people are being selfish and are subjecting others to risks even if they don't care about themselves. but I know I am pretty extreme in my thinking. I really love the outdoors and I go out pretty often before the pandemic. But it's just that my own thinking is rigid and made up about it. But anyhow, that's the situation in a nutshell. sys(Information): I think we all do black-or-white thinking to some extent. We're wired to try and make sense of the world, and maybe our brains don't like to spend time on nuance and grey areas. We all tend to quickly categorize things into good or bad, easy or hard, black or white. usr: yeah I understand your thinking with the grey areas as well. I suppose for this case, it's all black and white for me, no grea areas or compromises. that's good analysis by the way. But anyhow I am good to go then. Thank you so very much for understanding and for your valuable inputs. sys(Question): Does this time have to be a "waste" for you? With no productivity? That seems pretty extreme. usr: it's a fascinating area though, fascinating thinking. I am also curious on the social and mental implications of this in the long-run but only time will tell there will be so much research and books written about our times. well I do a lot of "waste" at home. So I am quite sluggish and lazy and lost at home. sys(Providing Suggestions): Thanks for saying that! I liked talking with you, and we can wrap this up. I guess I'm saying you sound thoughtful and intelligent, I'm confident that you could find ways to get more out of this time if that's what you're wanting to do. usr: I am productive but not as driven or productive as before at home. for sure yeah. I am sure we can get through all this in one piece eventually. I was thinking this also that even though this is a very tough time, we will look back on this about years from now, and say wow, we got through all that! sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Not as productive? Of course! It's a pandemic. We all are. :) Hope you're not too hard on yourself right now. usr: no no I am okay thanks for asking I am just kind of spelling in out the details of my thinking and how my life has been so far I am actually okay so no worries
label: ['Affirmation and Reassurance']

text: usr: Hello I am here to discuss my anxiety over the current pandemic. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question): Hey there! That's a good topic to talk about. With everything that's been going on, it's normal to feel some anxiety. What do you think is one thing that is giving you a lot of anxiety? usr: Thank you very much for your understanding. Yeah it's tough especially with rising cases for the past two weeks or so in my city. I live in Canada and my city is pretty good so far and really low on numbers but have been seeing new cases every day for the last two weeks or so so that adds anxiety to me when I go out and I am more on guard and paranoid sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): I'm sorry to hear that. Similar stuff is happening where I am, and I also get anxious hearing about it. usr: And we had a lock-down earlier this year and yet, with the exception of one province, every province remains operational at full speed despite lock-downs earlier, and now a lot of provinces are seeing record cases with the second wave. yeah I hope you get through this okay also and stay safe and well. sys(Question, Affirmation and Reassurance): What do you feel when you feel on guard and paranoid? Try to say some more about that if you can. Thanks, I hope the same for you. usr: I go out pretty much only when I have a purpose and personal admin/errands. I work about one or two days a week out of my home. So with the rising cases, I just feel anxious having to get out of the safety of my home. I was a lot more anxious earlier this year though. I am much more used to it at this time. And it's hard where everyday is the same for me and staying at home, without a change of pace like even simple walks outside, going to the gym, or going to hike or run etc. I pretty much missed out the whole year after March. My life has been on hold and I am just surprised that it's even november now, because it feels like I am still stuck in March. sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing, Restatement or Paraphrasing): Yeah, that makes sense. When this was all new, the uncertainty probably made for more anxiety. Now that we know some more about what is safe and what isn't, maybe less so. But it doesn't mean the anxiety is gone, of course. It's still around in our day-to-day lives. Well said. You feel stuck. The usual things you would do now are just not available to you. usr: yeah I have been adjusting to it and the cases were down and even to zero in my city for most of the last few months, but there's definitely the start of a new community spread now. yes correct Plus there's a loss of routine or motivation. I procrastinate a lot and get lost in thought or lost without thought. I don't work out as much as I used to (inside or outside of home). I don't eat as well and my sleep pattern is not good at all (I sleep a lot later than I should). So I am disappointed in myself to say the least. and also feeling guilty to see myself waste my life and time this way and not being productive sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): I can rephrase some of this, if you don't mind. In a way, you're talking about activities that you may have used (gym, hikes, etc) to keep yourself in a good mood. Now that those don't seem available, you just don't have those opportunities to boost your mood. It makes sense that you would be feeling this way. usr: now I am more used to it of course, but this summarizes how I have been feeling for most of this year. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): I think you explained yourself really well. Thanks for sharing how you've been feeling. usr: yes you're right. That's exactly it. I think it's going to be this way for a long time. I see other people compromising and taking the risk to go out for walks or runs, and even to the gym. I could have done that for the last few months when we had zero cases for awhile, but I didn't want to gamble and compromise. And I still see those people as selfish when I choose to do what I think is right. yeah no worries. It's good that you understand and thank you for listening. sys(Question): Do you think if you went ahead anyway to the gym or out for runs that you would feel guilty for doing them? usr: We won't know more about the mental implications and the sociological aspects of the pandemic probably until years to come. I thought about that sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): Yeah, and that just throws on another layer of why things are difficult right now. No one wants to feel guilty for doing things that could help themselves. usr: to the gym, I certainly would. Because it's indoors and I do feel it's unsafe as there are many equipment that others could touch. Running I felt that way because the path that I usually run on is narrow and other people walk through it also. However, I did have second thoughts about that when the case numbers were down. But I finally decided to keep doing it and stick to all outdoor trips for essential business. but that's just me, and I know we all have different personalities, preferences, and tolerances of risks and acceptances, etc. sys(Question): Have you ever heard of the phrase "black or white thinking?" As in, thinking that situations or people are completely good or completely bad? Or completely doable or completely impossible? usr: so in my opinion, I feel a little indignant at the people that have been going out frivolously like there's nothing going on, to even gamble their safety and their family's. Like I live in an apartment building, and the people around me and below me are always going out, even for the last few months. So I don't feel safe either but also indignant that others are doing what I could have done, but that I had compromised on for my safety and everyone else's safety. So I just didn't feel it was fair for them to do that when I could have done that anytime I wanted. black and white thinking...let me think for this pandemic, it's pretty much black and white sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Yeah, I think I understand that too. I get really frustrated hearing about people hosting big parties or not wearing masks because they think it's no big deal. They're putting others at risk. usr: Because I either go out or I don't. I have to compromise my values and everything I worked hard to preserve for the last few months to go out, even if I put on extra protection etc. And I just rigidly refuse to compromise my values because I don't believe it's right. Because if I had done that, I would have done that already, and long ago. And even though it's really hard on me. yeah exactly. Because people are being selfish and are subjecting others to risks even if they don't care about themselves. but I know I am pretty extreme in my thinking. I really love the outdoors and I go out pretty often before the pandemic. But it's just that my own thinking is rigid and made up about it. But anyhow, that's the situation in a nutshell. sys(Information): I think we all do black-or-white thinking to some extent. We're wired to try and make sense of the world, and maybe our brains don't like to spend time on nuance and grey areas. We all tend to quickly categorize things into good or bad, easy or hard, black or white. usr: yeah I understand your thinking with the grey areas as well. I suppose for this case, it's all black and white for me, no grea areas or compromises. that's good analysis by the way. But anyhow I am good to go then. Thank you so very much for understanding and for your valuable inputs. sys(Question): Does this time have to be a "waste" for you? With no productivity? That seems pretty extreme. usr: it's a fascinating area though, fascinating thinking. I am also curious on the social and mental implications of this in the long-run but only time will tell there will be so much research and books written about our times. well I do a lot of "waste" at home. So I am quite sluggish and lazy and lost at home. sys(Providing Suggestions): Thanks for saying that! I liked talking with you, and we can wrap this up. I guess I'm saying you sound thoughtful and intelligent, I'm confident that you could find ways to get more out of this time if that's what you're wanting to do. usr: I am productive but not as driven or productive as before at home. for sure yeah. I am sure we can get through all this in one piece eventually. I was thinking this also that even though this is a very tough time, we will look back on this about years from now, and say wow, we got through all that! sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Not as productive? Of course! It's a pandemic. We all are. :) Hope you're not too hard on yourself right now. usr: no no I am okay thanks for asking I am just kind of spelling in out the details of my thinking and how my life has been so far I am actually okay so no worries sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Ha, exactly. Maybe we're not all thriving and getting rich and adding 15 pounds of muscle during this time. But we can get through it. usr: yup. Exactly. Lost time can always be made up later. okay then. I am good to go. Thanks again and thank you for your input. It does help to just kind of vent in a way.

And it's hard where everyday is the same for me and staying at home, without a change of pace like even simple walks outside, going to the gym, or going to hike or run etc. I pretty much missed out the whole year after March. My life has been on hold and I am just surprised that it's even november now, because it feels like I am still stuck in March. sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing, Restatement or Paraphrasing): Yeah, that makes sense. When this was all new, the uncertainty probably made for more anxiety. Now that we know some more about what is safe and what isn't, maybe less so. But it doesn't mean the anxiety is gone, of course. It's still around in our day-to-day lives. Well said. You feel stuck. The usual things you would do now are just not available to you. usr: yeah I have been adjusting to it and the cases were down and even to zero in my city for most of the last few months, but there's definitely the start of a new community spread now. yes correct Plus there's a loss of routine or motivation. I procrastinate a lot and get lost in thought or lost without thought. I don't work out as much as I used to (inside or outside of home). I don't eat as well and my sleep pattern is not good at all (I sleep a lot later than I should). So I am disappointed in myself to say the least. and also feeling guilty to see myself waste my life and time this way and not being productive sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): I can rephrase some of this, if you don't mind. In a way, you're talking about activities that you may have used (gym, hikes, etc) to keep yourself in a good mood. Now that those don't seem available, you just don't have those opportunities to boost your mood. It makes sense that you would be feeling this way. usr: now I am more used to it of course, but this summarizes how I have been feeling for most of this year. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): I think you explained yourself really well. Thanks for sharing how you've been feeling. usr: yes you're right. That's exactly it. I think it's going to be this way for a long time. I see other people compromising and taking the risk to go out for walks or runs, and even to the gym. I could have done that for the last few months when we had zero cases for awhile, but I didn't want to gamble and compromise. And I still see those people as selfish when I choose to do what I think is right. yeah no worries. It's good that you understand and thank you for listening. sys(Question): Do you think if you went ahead anyway to the gym or out for runs that you would feel guilty for doing them? usr: We won't know more about the mental implications and the sociological aspects of the pandemic probably until years to come. I thought about that sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): Yeah, and that just throws on another layer of why things are difficult right now. No one wants to feel guilty for doing things that could help themselves. usr: to the gym, I certainly would. Because it's indoors and I do feel it's unsafe as there are many equipment that others could touch. Running I felt that way because the path that I usually run on is narrow and other people walk through it also. However, I did have second thoughts about that when the case numbers were down. But I finally decided to keep doing it and stick to all outdoor trips for essential business. but that's just me, and I know we all have different personalities, preferences, and tolerances of risks and acceptances, etc. sys(Question): Have you ever heard of the phrase "black or white thinking?" As in, thinking that situations or people are completely good or completely bad? Or completely doable or completely impossible? usr: so in my opinion, I feel a little indignant at the people that have been going out frivolously like there's nothing going on, to even gamble their safety and their family's. Like I live in an apartment building, and the people around me and below me are always going out, even for the last few months. So I don't feel safe either but also indignant that others are doing what I could have done, but that I had compromised on for my safety and everyone else's safety. So I just didn't feel it was fair for them to do that when I could have done that anytime I wanted. black and white thinking...let me think for this pandemic, it's pretty much black and white sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Yeah, I think I understand that too. I get really frustrated hearing about people hosting big parties or not wearing masks because they think it's no big deal. They're putting others at risk. usr: Because I either go out or I don't. I have to compromise my values and everything I worked hard to preserve for the last few months to go out, even if I put on extra protection etc. And I just rigidly refuse to compromise my values because I don't believe it's right. Because if I had done that, I would have done that already, and long ago. And even though it's really hard on me. yeah exactly. Because people are being selfish and are subjecting others to risks even if they don't care about themselves. but I know I am pretty extreme in my thinking. I really love the outdoors and I go out pretty often before the pandemic. But it's just that my own thinking is rigid and made up about it. But anyhow, that's the situation in a nutshell. sys(Information): I think we all do black-or-white thinking to some extent. We're wired to try and make sense of the world, and maybe our brains don't like to spend time on nuance and grey areas. We all tend to quickly categorize things into good or bad, easy or hard, black or white. usr: yeah I understand your thinking with the grey areas as well. I suppose for this case, it's all black and white for me, no grea areas or compromises. that's good analysis by the way. But anyhow I am good to go then. Thank you so very much for understanding and for your valuable inputs. sys(Question): Does this time have to be a "waste" for you? With no productivity? That seems pretty extreme. usr: it's a fascinating area though, fascinating thinking. I am also curious on the social and mental implications of this in the long-run but only time will tell there will be so much research and books written about our times. well I do a lot of "waste" at home. So I am quite sluggish and lazy and lost at home. sys(Providing Suggestions): Thanks for saying that! I liked talking with you, and we can wrap this up. I guess I'm saying you sound thoughtful and intelligent, I'm confident that you could find ways to get more out of this time if that's what you're wanting to do. usr: I am productive but not as driven or productive as before at home. for sure yeah. I am sure we can get through all this in one piece eventually. I was thinking this also that even though this is a very tough time, we will look back on this about years from now, and say wow, we got through all that! sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Not as productive? Of course! It's a pandemic. We all are. :) Hope you're not too hard on yourself right now. usr: no no I am okay thanks for asking I am just kind of spelling in out the details of my thinking and how my life has been so far I am actually okay so no worries sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Ha, exactly. Maybe we're not all thriving and getting rich and adding 15 pounds of muscle during this time. But we can get through it. usr: yup. Exactly. Lost time can always be made up later. okay then. I am good to go. Thanks again and thank you for your input. It does help to just kind of vent in a way. sys(Question): Before we quit, would you want to say one specific thing you know you can do today to help yourself out? usr: Yeah for sure I worked out a little bit before I started the chat. I am also doing some online courses on my own time. So I will keep working hard on those. And I hope to get back more into the routine of working out. I really do think it helps my mood if I just make more time and motivation for that. And you seem intelligent and analytical also and you know what I mean. So I do appreciate your time and input sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Nice! Good job with those things. usr: thanks. I hope you best of luck then with all your endeavours. I know we can all get through this time. Thank you. stay well and stay safe my friend sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Right on, same to you. It's okay to feel anxious right now. It's okay to feel unproductive right now. It's also okay to keep on doing the things that make you feel okay. Great job keeping up the workouts and the classes. usr: Thank you and all the best.
label: ['Affirmation and Reassurance']

I will help you to find some solution Why are you feeling emotionally sad? usr: With this kind of pandemic situation, it is making me more upset as I am not able to go out to socialize with people to foget my problems. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): The pandemic situation is tough for everyone, so don't worry usr: My boyfriend brokeup with me 6 months ago and without saying good bye face to face.....it is just making me wonder why? sys(Reflection of feelings): I am sorry to hear that. usr: We were not able to see each other ever since the pandemic and we just ended our relationship sys(Providing Suggestions): I would like to give some suggestions usr: that would be great sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Please ask your boyfriend to discuss to me so that i can advice him usr: We don't talk anymore. I could not reach him and i do not want to talk to him too sys(Reflection of feelings): This pandemic is taking longer time to settle because many people do not follow the guidelines suggested usr: definately.... sys(Providing Suggestions, Providing Suggestions): Please do not get upset. Try to understand each other then only it is possible to reconcile Please cooperate with each other so you can be back together usr: I don't want to see him or talk to him. I just want to get on with my life to start a brand new one. I am just feeling so sad and depressed. sys(Question): Is my advice helpful to you? usr: no. are not telling me how i can get my depression away sys(Providing Suggestions): Don't be upset we all come across difficult times in life. This is one of the time. usr: thank you. i will forget and take it one at a time. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Please seek some interesting relaxation for mind. If you deviate your mind from getting upset then you can overcome this depression. usr: I will try....
label: ['Reflection of feelings']

No, I do well, it just causes me a great amount of stress. sys(Self-disclosure): I hear you, I have been in a similar situation. Parents sometimes do not realise just how much pressure they are putting on their children to be perfect. usr: I feel like as long as I am meeting the requirements and am passing, she should be proud of my accomplishments. She should be proud I am even going to college. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question): Exactly! there is nothing at all wrong with not being a straight A student. Have you tried to tell her how you feel about her behaviour and attitude towards your studies? usr: Exactly. I feel like there is this society stereotype of needing straight A's otherwise you are a failure or something. A bit, but she uses the "I pay for your education" card. Which makes sense, but still, I know I am doing well so it's just a lot at times. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Absolutely not. There is nothing wrong with not being perfect. And she has no right to emotionally manipulate you by mentioning money. usr: I agree, but she does have money over my head, which sucks. Don't get me wrong, I am very grateful for her financial support, but she uses it to manipulate me at times. sys(Question): Are there any scholarships or hardship funds that you could potentially look into applying for? usr: Yes, I have received multiple scholarships, but nothing that will make a dent in the tuition. College is too expensive. sys(Self-disclosure): Ah, it is very expensive isn't it? I understand, I am still paying off my loans! But it should be worth it in the end. One day you could get a job working for Amazon! usr: That's what I keep telling myself, but I have this overarching fear that I will be in debt forever then. sys(Self-disclosure): Debt is a very scary thing to experience, I know. I do worry a lot about it sometimes too so you are not alone. usr: That makes me feel better. sys(Question): The main thing is, do you enjoy your studies and consider them worthwhile? usr: yes, somewhat, but who loves school? sys(Self-disclosure): I really did enjoy University .. I made a lot of friends and it was a good learning experience. I hope you feel a bit the same? usr: S Somewhat, but all I feel I have time for is the school work not the social aspect so much sys(Question): I think that you need to be easier on yourself. Do you have many friends? usr: some sys(Question): Are you able to confide in your friends about your situation and your worries? usr: Yes at times, which makes things a little better in the moment. sys(Question): Do you feel that your friends are able to empathise with your situation? Are any of them going through the same thing? usr: they all have more independence and pay for their own things, so they can't really relate to me. That is where I feel behind in life than everyone else. sys(Question): Would it be possible for you to get a part time job of some description? Maybe bar tending or working in a restaurant? usr: That gives me social anxiety, which is something I also struggle with greatly.
label: ['Self-disclosure', 'Others']

text: sys(Question): Hi there, what's going on today? usr: Just dealing with alot of depression lately due to issues with a lot of things. The most of which being with my ex-gf and her pregnancy. She immediately cut me off once she gave birth, so I haven't met or seen my child. It's been 7 months. We were in the process of working on an agreement outside of court and since this I've had to work with the court to get this started but it's been hard with COVID and not being able to meet with someone in person.
label: ['Question']

text: sys(Question): Hi there, what's going on today? usr: Just dealing with alot of depression lately due to issues with a lot of things. The most of which being with my ex-gf and her pregnancy. She immediately cut me off once she gave birth, so I haven't met or seen my child. It's been 7 months. We were in the process of working on an agreement outside of court and since this I've had to work with the court to get this started but it's been hard with COVID and not being able to meet with someone in person. sys(Question): Did you sign the birth certificate? usr: No. That's the other thing. She didn't let me know about the birth until 2 hours after the fact. The hospital would only let one person there with her and her sister was there. I don't know if she put someone else as the father or not.
label: ['Affirmation and Reassurance', 'Providing Suggestions']

Are you sleeping okay at night? usr: I'm getting plenty of sleep, and I do practice meditation, maybe not as often as I should, I meditate five minutes per day sys(Providing Suggestions): I would suggest trying Mindfulness exercises for at least 15 minutes every day and see if that helps. usr: I'll see if that helps, I'm really low on energy right now because it just takes so much out of me sys(Information): I understand, Sometimes the Mindfulness exercises help me get more productive sleep. usr: I try to do mindfulness before bed, but I'm always too tired. I think it would be better if I did them in the afternoon at some point, did you use guided meditation? sys(Information): I did, ASMR guidance seems to help me most, but I happen to be ASMR sensative, perhaps you are as well? They seem to help with my anxiety as well. usr: Are those the videos on youtube where the sound is enhanced? Those are soothing sys(Others): Yes, Kind of like whispers, almost like Bob Ross on those old painting videos. usr: Just talking about my anxiety has helped a lot actually, and I do enjoy bob ross, hadn't thought of that as therapeutic but it makes sense sys(Reflection of feelings): I am glad I could be helpful. usr: Yes, thank you for your help Take care now!
label: ['Reflection of feelings']

text: sys(Others): HOw are you doing? usr: Hako So so. sys(Question): What's wrong? usr: kind of down holiday season sys(Reflection of feelings): I'm sorry to hear that, what about the holidays has you down? usr: loneliness by myself sys(Question): Do you live alone or do you have other family members in the same house? usr: i live alone I am looking to move south sys(Others): I'm sorry to hear that, do you have family that lives nearby? usr: My family is allover the country no family near me sys(Others): Are there some in the South? usr: I am in Georgia trying to go to Florida My family is up north sys(Reflection of feelings): Is there a reason you're trying to get further away from family? usr: I am trying to start and settle down I am single/divorced and want to start fresh My family knows that. I am older sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): That sounds like a good idea then. Meet someone to settle down with and get through this with. usr: That is my goal. Also get to teh beach sys(Self-disclosure): I'm in the North, so anything outdoors sounds nice right about now. usr: I used to live up north but the cold got to me sys(Reflection of feelings): It's definitely not for everyone. Amazing how temperature can mess with your mood as well. Something about sun and sand can really put you in a good mood. usr: i grew up in the snow country sys(Self-disclosure): Same here, we have snow on the ground and negative temps projected for later in the week. usr: I heard. I was heading north but the weather stopped me sys(Information): Are you spending the holidays with anyone if you're not heading north? usr: no the virus stopped it I will be alone and not anyone around sys(Providing Suggestions): I'm sorry to hear that, this is such a crazy year for everyone. I'm sorry to hear you'll be alone. Have you ever considered volunteering? usr: not where I am at. Just staying low because of the virus sys(Providing Suggestions): It's smart to be safe. usr: Where I am the virus isn't bad. Just hoping to get to Florida soon sys(Providing Suggestions): Maybe you can do some research on areas and places to move during the holidays. Look forward to when you can sit on the beach. usr: I have been but I can't plan a date until the 1st sys(Information): That's coming up pretty quick though so that's good usr: Yes and I will start south again Ok. Thanks for the chat. Have a good night

Do you have any tips? sys(Providing Suggestions, Self-disclosure): I like to set mini goals for myself to make long term goals attainable. For example, I am in college and if I have to write a 8 page paper, I push myself to write at least 1 page every day until I finish. Then I have enough time to edit and make the deadline. Another suggestion is to remind yourself why you need to wake up and get things going! For me, I know I want to help others in the future but without the degree I am going for, I would not be able to help. usr: That sounds very simple and useful. All of the things I used to enjoy doing I can no longer do becuase they all invloved live audiences.

Have you spoken to your supervisor about your frustrations at work? usr: I have, but sometimes I feel like she doesn't really listen and she sort of talks over me a lot sys(Reflection of feelings): It sounds like you don't feel listened to. usr: That's right... I guess that is quite a lot of the problem. I don't mind so much the work, I know it is busy for everyone right now, it's a combination of the workload plus not being listened to sys(Self-disclosure): I had a similar issue at my last job. My supervisor constantly spoke over me in meetings, and it would drive me crazy. I never could get a word in edge-wise. usr: Yeah, that sounds a lot like what I am experiencing sys(Question): Are you considering switching jobs? usr: It's been in the back of my mind, but it's a hard time just now with everything else going on
label: ['Affirmation and Reassurance']

text: usr: I swear, I can't take these lockdowns anymore.
label: ['Reflection of feelings', 'Self-disclosure']

text: usr: I swear, I can't take these lockdowns anymore. sys(Reflection of feelings, Self-disclosure): I can definetely understand why. During this pandemic we have been more isolated than ever It's not easy usr: I mean it's one thing to limit capacities in places, but to say we're not allowed to go to our friends' and family's home is just plain ridiculous.
label: ['Self-disclosure']

text: usr: I swear, I can't take these lockdowns anymore. sys(Reflection of feelings, Self-disclosure): I can definetely understand why. During this pandemic we have been more isolated than ever It's not easy usr: I mean it's one thing to limit capacities in places, but to say we're not allowed to go to our friends' and family's home is just plain ridiculous. sys(Self-disclosure): It is more than reasonable to be frustrated with regards to that. I myself have not been able to visit my ill mother. She lives in another country, so it's especially difficult. usr: That is a shame. I mean I know people can still do Zoom or Facetime, but I imagine you can related to me in knowing that both of those options are not the same as face to face.
label: ['Affirmation and Reassurance']

text: usr: I swear, I can't take these lockdowns anymore. sys(Reflection of feelings, Self-disclosure): I can definetely understand why. During this pandemic we have been more isolated than ever It's not easy usr: I mean it's one thing to limit capacities in places, but to say we're not allowed to go to our friends' and family's home is just plain ridiculous. sys(Self-disclosure): It is more than reasonable to be frustrated with regards to that. I myself have not been able to visit my ill mother. She lives in another country, so it's especially difficult. usr: That is a shame. I mean I know people can still do Zoom or Facetime, but I imagine you can related to me in knowing that both of those options are not the same as face to face. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Exactly, the experience feels like it lacks the main connection we share with our loved ones. It is totally normal to want to be face to face instead. usr: I think that's the other thing that these lockdowns are doing; they're sucking the emotional aspects out of activities and pastimes we love. Instead of laughing or jumping with fright in theaters with everyone, we now have to do it with ourselves. Rather than cheering as an audience over a touchdown, it's now a crowd of one. It just feels robotic now.
label: ['Affirmation and Reassurance', 'Information']

It's certainly maddening.

text: usr: I swear, I can't take these lockdowns anymore. sys(Reflection of feelings, Self-disclosure): I can definetely understand why. During this pandemic we have been more isolated than ever It's not easy usr: I mean it's one thing to limit capacities in places, but to say we're not allowed to go to our friends' and family's home is just plain ridiculous. sys(Self-disclosure): It is more than reasonable to be frustrated with regards to that. I myself have not been able to visit my ill mother. She lives in another country, so it's especially difficult. usr: That is a shame. I mean I know people can still do Zoom or Facetime, but I imagine you can related to me in knowing that both of those options are not the same as face to face. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Exactly, the experience feels like it lacks the main connection we share with our loved ones. It is totally normal to want to be face to face instead. usr: I think that's the other thing that these lockdowns are doing; they're sucking the emotional aspects out of activities and pastimes we love. Instead of laughing or jumping with fright in theaters with everyone, we now have to do it with ourselves. Rather than cheering as an audience over a touchdown, it's now a crowd of one. It just feels robotic now. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Information): I agree with you, what used to be super-exciting activities now have a much more monotonous feeling. However, it's not the end of the world. Thankfully, researchers have just came up with a vaccine prototype I heard. usr: Yeah, but even with the distribution, some people are saying that things won't return to normal till about late spring/early summer. It's certainly maddening. sys(Providing Suggestions): I know it's not easy, but try to think of this whole situation of a challenge that you are overcoming. What doesn't kill you only makes you stronger. You will come out of this ready for any hardships that life might throw at you. usr: I guess, I still think our responce to this was sloppy at best. I mean, lockdown the healthy masses due to a discease with a 99% survival rate? It just doesn't make sense in my book. I'm just glad this silliness will be over soon. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Providing Suggestions, Affirmation and Reassurance): It will hopefully be over sooner than we think. Just try to keep a positive attitude, focus on the things you like, and time will fly. I know it can be hard, but I am sure you got this usr: I think over time (sooner than later hopefully) I'll be able to get over it. Thank you very much for talking to me. sys(Others): It has been a pleasure : ) usr: Have a good day :)
label: ['Others']

Obviously not that direct but reading between the lines you know? sys(Providing Suggestions): Hmmmm, First of all stop being panicked, You still have your job usr: I guess so. I can't help feeling a sense of dread though like I'm next. sys(Providing Suggestions): The good thing is you anticipate losing your job, so you have the advantage here usr: How so? sys(Information, Information): You can prepare yourself for that! yes, as simple as this Search for new jobs, get help from your wife and friends usr: What kind of help? sys(Information): Search locally and online, If you try enough you will see the results soon usr: I've been searching for the past month. It's just been so hard trying to break through to an interview. sys(Others): Help in searching for jobs and supporting you emotionally usr: It's been frustrating. I've sent out 50 resumes and got 3 interviews. sys(Information, Affirmation and Reassurance): Let me be straight ok? you somehow don't have any other options but searching You can do it! who knows! maybe you will get a better job usr: Do you have any tips? It just seems I can't find a thng thing sys(Information): Look at this situation as an opportunity, you still have your job and you can search for even a better job usr: Yes, that's what I've been trying to do. I just can't find anything. Or get my foot in the door anywhere sys(Providing Suggestions): Don't get disappointed, put effort, seek new methods for searching, research online usr: Do you know any new methods for searching?
label: ['Providing Suggestions']

text: usr: Hi. I'm a little stressed out at the moment over losing my job in the coming months.
label: ['Reflection of feelings', 'Question']

text: usr: Hi. I'm a little stressed out at the moment over losing my job in the coming months. sys(Reflection of feelings, Question): I'm sorry to hear about that! I can totally understand why you'd be stressed. Is it for certain that you will lose your job? usr: The company I work for is winding down. i'm on the old side to be looking for a job and i'm likely going to have to accept a lower salary, a longer commute and a heavier workload. In other words, I have a job I love, close to where I live that is very manageable. I can't sleep and I'm insanely anxious all of the time.
label: ['Affirmation and Reassurance']

text: usr: Hi. I'm a little stressed out at the moment over losing my job in the coming months. sys(Reflection of feelings, Question): I'm sorry to hear about that! I can totally understand why you'd be stressed. Is it for certain that you will lose your job? usr: The company I work for is winding down. i'm on the old side to be looking for a job and i'm likely going to have to accept a lower salary, a longer commute and a heavier workload. In other words, I have a job I love, close to where I live that is very manageable. I can't sleep and I'm insanely anxious all of the time. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): I can feel your anxiety, and I completely understand why you're feeling that way, but you don't know for sure that will be true. Have you started looking for a new job already? usr: I started looking for a job last week. I had a transition meeting today to pass on the little bit of my work that will be left to another person. I have 2 children; one who just started college this fall and another who is a junior in high school. my elderly mother lives with me also so I can't sell my house any time soon and move into something smaller and cheaper. I feel really trapped at the moment.
label: ['Providing Suggestions']

It's definitely a lot of things to deal with all at once, but it would help to break things down so they're more manageable. Do you have anyone close by who can help you out? usr: i have friends and family close by. i don't like to burden people with my problems. I know i also don't adjust well to change and that doesn't help. breaking issues down into groups is helpful and may take away some of the enormity of everything.
label: ['Self-disclosure', 'Providing Suggestions']

I do not know what I did wrong. sys(Others): You did nothing wrong. It's something wrong with him, if he did this to you, he'll probably do it again to her. Do you really want to be with someone that disregards your well being like that? usr: That is a very sensible way to look at things .. I do rationally realise that. Irrationally I just want him to come back to me and say that he made a mistake, though! sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): I understand, it's easy to get sucked back into the nostalgic good memories of when things were at their best usr: That's exactly it! I keep thinking of all the good times we had together and the things that we did before her met Her. I just want those times to come around again even though I know they should not. sys(Others): It really sucks, doesn't it? And it's not a walk in the park to get over someone when you've been so close to them. Breakups are kind of like a bad cut. They really hurt for a bit, but then a scar eventually forms over it and you start to forget about it. usr: Thank you - you are really helping me to understand how I am feeling. I think that perhaps the scar never goes away but yes, hopefully it will not hurt anymore one day sys(Providing Suggestions, Reflection of feelings): Do you have a group of friends, or activities to keep you busy while you're going through this? It helps to keep your mind distracted :) And you are so welcome! I've been through my share of breakups too, it's never fun! usr: I do have some good friends but we also had some mutual friends who have been a bit distant with me since the break up. I guess that I really don't need them though, huh?
label: ['Providing Suggestions']

text: sys(Question): Hello! How can I help you today? usr: I'M PASSING THROUGH DEPRESSION sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): That sounds really rough. When did this begin? usr: TODAY I LOST A VERY DEAR FRIEND sys(Reflection of feelings): I am so sorry to hear this! Losing a close friend can be very difficult.Communicating your feelings is a step in the right direction to cope with your emotions. usr: i dont know how i can get over ,its heart breaking since i heard about the sad news of his demise have been taking Alcohol since to wipe away the emotion but its seems its getting more complicated sys(Question): I can tell you are very sad about this situation and understandably so. It seems as if alcohol is your coping mechanism right now correct? Do you have close friends to share your emotions with? usr: yes , i normally take Alcohol any time am going through any sad moment , i dont have friends near by , am the nly one at home sys(Self-disclosure): I see. I also am the only one in my home and frequently have no one to turn to during hard times. Have you thought about a local grief counselor? usr: yes , i am actually thinking about that when mymind is at ease actually i dont like disclosing my affairs or what am passing through with strangers sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Providing Suggestions): You have taken this step and most counselors can do virtual meetings if you would like to keep yourself anonymous. I know it would be really hard for but I have total confidence in you! Have you tried any other ways besides alcohol? usr: owk, thanks not really , i havent take anything except alcohol sys(Providing Suggestions): Journaling your feelings has also been an effective way to get the emotions out! You seem like you have a lot to share so it might be a good option for you! usr: yea i will try to consult counselors sys(Reflection of feelings): I am so glad to hear this! I know you will get through this stronger than before! usr: yes, thanks for the concern sys(Others): I hope I have helped and provided a safe place for you to share. You will get through this! Remember to take one day at a time and never be scared to ask for help! usr: very well , i reall appreciate God bless

text: usr: hello sys(Question): Hi! How are you this evening? usr: pretty depressed all in all. I dont know how to get out of this slump sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): Sorry to hear that. How long have you been in a slump? usr: Quite a while, of course it really got worse once the pandemic hit I am in a pretty bad marriage he is not supportive in any way. He argued with her sys(Self-disclosure, Self-disclosure): My husband and I have gone a few times and it really helped having an objective person give us a few tips. I have gone by myself because I needed extra help. And it's hard to deal with someone who doesn't want to grow and change. usr: I am happy it worked for you :) I just dont see it working with us. Hes pretty stubborn. I also struggle with a severe auto immune disorder so that is always weighing on me as well

text: usr: hello sys(Question): Hi! How are you this evening? usr: pretty depressed all in all. I dont know how to get out of this slump sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): Sorry to hear that. Emotions have a way of wreaking havoc on our bodies. And it sounds like life has been stressful for you lately. Having a physical problem is really hard to deal with in addition to problems in marriage. Do you have any goals set? usr: Yes, stress is terrible for chronic illness. I had goals to get back in check with myself, I've been worried about everyone else for so long and not really about me. The pandemic haulted a lot of that. I used to take rides and go out and enjoy nature or something simple by myself to rejuvinate but it's harder now being worried to be around people. I also have an 8 and 1 year old. While they are my world, it's taxing having littles depend on you 24/7 without a breather :)
label: ['Reflection of feelings', 'Others']

For example. I realized I didn't speak respectfully to him all the time. So I changed my tone. Sometimes I didn't FEEL respectful, but I read this book explaining how men really need that. So I changed me. And you know what, he really responded well to that. Became more kind and loving. I prayed a lot and that is one thing God showed me. I read a few books on what men were like and how I could help my marriage. My husband often oblivious, but when I worked on me and doing things that men like, he actually became a better man. Hard to explain. I would encourage you to write out some goals and things you want to change about yourself, ideas for you and your children to do. And fight the blues as hard as you can. I find that if I have a list of things I need to do, I can follow that even when I don't feel like it, and sometimes I get out of the slump. usr: It makes total sense. I have tried to do some research and yes work on myself as well. I have done a ton of praying. I do need to make new goals. They help me stay on track, thats for sure. Of course now that I'm home schooling my oldest I'm tearing my hair out there as welll. lol! I always had a huge amount of respect for teachers, but wow!
label: ['Affirmation and Reassurance', 'Others']

Of course now that I'm home schooling my oldest I'm tearing my hair out there as welll. lol! I always had a huge amount of respect for teachers, but wow! sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Others): It sounds like you do know good things to do, and that sometimes you need that encouragement and and support. Do you have friends maybe to check in with? Just to chat. I have been doing that myself. Just phoning people to connect. It has helped so much. Just to say hi and share my life. Life has a way of handing us curveballs. It upsets us then we don't know what to do, we fall down and get in a slump. And I find that writing lists, making goals, calling friends, doing things differently, brainstorming solutions can help me get back on track. usr: I need to do that more! When my maternal grandma passed away in 2013 I kind of fell away from just calling people up. She was my go to person to call, always. She and my grandpa raised me and its been hard to pick up a phone knowing I cannot call her. Sounds weird I know sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): It is NOT weird. I'm like a granma to you! hahaha I'm almost 60. We need people in our lives, older, younger, all ages. We all learn from each other. Perhaps call and aunt and check in with them. Sometimes it makes us feel better to reach out and encourage others. usr: I will try to do this more, for sure! Thank you for this conversation, I feel like it has helped me remember the things I can do to start working on myself again! sys(Information): As for your son and homeschooling, I'm sure you are challenged but think of this as a great opportunity. Perhaps teach him to cook? Make games up that are learning games about how to care for a home, perhaps repair things, all kinds of ideas. Perhaps have him test you on things. usr: Sounds like a plan for sure :) I will do this, he would really enjoy it!
label: ['Others']

Are you there? I am seeking some support in this crazy world? The thing is that his files contained really gross porn and live webcam sites. What should I do? When I confronted him he said it was not him! He lied so horribly! I am heartbroken. I also found out that he has had many different profiles on facebook that are just covert operations. What would you think? Please tell me what advice you would give? His spam folder is full of crap! all of it like Fuck me here and now! Hello there are you there? sys(Others): sorry i'm here usr: I have checked his email folders and we have talked about his over the top usage of porn and online dating sites. He has admitted that he is in fact a sex addict! Should I hold on or should I let it go? Just find someone else that I can actually trust? sys(Question, Question): First of all, I have a fre questions to ask Does the idea of him being sex addict change how you feel about him? usr: What's the fre question? what is fre? Not necessarily . Just the trust issue really. sys(Others): I would say you should cut tie with him. Being into porn is a serious issue but what's more important is he lied to you about that usr: We've known each other for years and have been friends for a very long time.. We dated on and off and things just seem to always go back to this weird off place. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): I think you can also feel it yourself that there's something not right between you and him usr: I appreciate your thoughts. So you don't think I should give him another chance? sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Providing Suggestions): This is a wake up call for you I must say, to get away from him I think you should sit down and tell him to take a break, this doesn't mean completely break up but some time for both of you to think it over usr: I feel like I really can't trust him and find myself looking through his computer and phone questioning things. makes me feel crazy. sys(Reflection of feelings): I understand how you feel, it's not easy to get over this feeling usr: Is this a clean site or do people use it for porn chat? sys(Others): That's why you need some time for yourself to think whether you can forgive him and try to help him or not usr: I know . That sounds like great advice. Hard to pull off during the pandemic though. sys(Self-disclosure, Question): To be honest, watching porn is normal, however, I feel that if someone is too into it, as in watch it more than 1-2 times a month, it's problematic and won't be easy to fix Do you live with him? usr: Ah. I think it's more of a real issue when it comes to controlling himself or using sites because he was single for so long. He is currently staying with me. sys(Providing Suggestions): You can ask him to stop doing that for you, if he really cares, he will try usr: His latest obsession has been 3d printing. I have found weird sites with ' funny'' dildos on them in his feed and stored data. Do you think he might be gay? Like humor I understand but... sys(Others): goodness usr: stored data with adult printed groups on fb! dildos with star wars themes. Immature stuff. IDK.? sys(Providing Suggestions): That you have to ask him, tell him to have an honest thought, no judgement, be completely honest with each other usr: He laughs when I show him mens underwear. I think maybe that's a sign he's uncomfortable. What do you think? sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question): Yeah, laughs can definitely be a sign of someone getting nervous Does he have any close male friends? usr: Yep That's what I thought too. He does have a few close male friends. Nothing that looks suspicious though. sys(Others): Whether he's gay or not, it's hard to say just from a few things, but what's more important right now is for you two to sit down and talk usr: I wonder if there is a way to find out why he joined all of these weird servers and is trying to learn code. Is it really for 3d printing or is it to make a secret platform to hide his data etc?
label: ['Providing Suggestions']

But I know my night will get worse as it goes on sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): You think your night is going to have emotional upset? text: usr: Hello sys(Question): Hello! How are you tonight? usr: I'm okay i guess. I have struggled to deal with depression most of my life, so I know it can be debilitating, but I have found ways to help myself. A good listener is worth her weight in gold. usr: I've learned that mines not really an emotional thing. I feel like my sleeping issue causes my depression. Because no matter what- i always feel exhausted. Nothing has helped it besides medication. It just sucks always feeling fatigued and energyless. I actually did take up religion here this year to help with the coping that comes with this. It was very helpful for a while there sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Self-disclosure): If I didn't get good rest, then I would definitely feel tired the next day and over time, it would wear me out. I believe medication will help with the symptoms, but it is important to get the root of the problem, why exactly you find it difficult to sleep. Sometimes I take a benydryl because they always make me sleepy, but I usually know why I need to relax, I'm nervous about the next day. So I have found it important to know WHY I don't rest well, if that makes sense to you. usr: I plan on seeing a sleep doctor soon! Sometimes I lose sight of fixing the issue and need to be reminded. And yes!! I was treating my sleeping with Benadryl as well but it wasn't healthy to keep doing that.

text: usr: Hello sys(Question): Hello! How are you tonight? usr: I'm okay i guess. Do you fear you will not be physically safe? usr: I know i'll be safe.. but I have depression and it affects me the most at night, every night. I feel like i can't escape it. sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Question): I'm sorry to hear that. I have struggled to deal with depression most of my life, so I know it can be debilitating, but I have found ways to help myself. Is there a specific problem making you depressed, or life in general? usr: I'd love to hear them. There is one problem in general i'm having that i seem to have always had because of the Depression. I have an extremely difficult time falling asleep.. and whenever I do manage to fall asleep.. i wake up always feeling like crap. I never feel rested no matter how long i sleep. sys(Reflection of feelings, Self-disclosure): I have had trouble sleeping in the past and sometimes I still do, usually if it is when I'm nervous about the future. The number one way I have had to help my depression is to pray and read scripture. I don't know if you are a Christian, but that has helped me a lot. The second way is to have a good friend who will listen, not someone who will TELL me what to do or judge me, but someone who can empathize with me. A good listener is worth her weight in gold. usr: I've learned that mines not really an emotional thing. I feel like my sleeping issue causes my depression. I actually did take up religion here this year to help with the coping that comes with this. It was very helpful for a while there sys(Affirmation and Reassurance, Self-disclosure): If I didn't get good rest, then I would definitely feel tired the next day and over time, it would wear me out. I believe medication will help with the symptoms, but it is important to get the root of the problem, why exactly you find it difficult to sleep. Sometimes I take a benydryl because they always make me sleepy, but I usually know why I need to relax, I'm nervous about the next day. I was advised to get soft sheets, make my sleeping area more restful, make sure the time before bed is relaxing and calming. I also was helped a lot by a Christian Preacher, he's long dead, but he has audio on youtube -- Frank Hammond, Pigs in the Parlor. It's a 5 part series I found helpful, you might want to jot that down. And I do encourage you to find a counselor, once you rule out the physical (doctor) then you can look at emotional, mental and/or spiritual. I think most of everything is spiritual and emotional to some degree, and our body just responds to that. usr: I always lose sight of how to make things better. It really helps to talk sometimes so someone can help me put things into perspective. I'll look into Frank Hammond! I am actually religious and would love to look into that.

I got married and my husbands family is not accepting to get me proceed with my masters degree.Iam very depressed about that.. sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): so if I understand you correctly, you cannot continue your studies because your in-laws don't want you to? usr: yes..and iam finding it difficult to cope with that.. sys(Self-disclosure): That sounds very disappointing, I can understand why you are feeling down about this. I had to stop university halfway through for health reasons, and was not able to go back, I found that depressing too. usr: How did you manage to get out of the depression..If you dont mind,can you tell me what happened? sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): it is hard to let go of a dream. it's normal to feel down about it. usr: Can you suggest some remedies of how to get out of depression.. sys(Self-disclosure, Providing Suggestions): I have mental health issues so I could not continue my studies, sadly. I take antidepressants and have a counselor. is there anyone you can talk to about your depresion, perhaps your doctor? usr: Oh I cannot go to counsellor because of they are too expensive.. I want to talk about it to some one but even my parents are not very supportive of me.. sys(Providing Suggestions, Reflection of feelings): Are you in a city? Some cities have free counselors oh dear that is hard when your family is not behind you usr: Yes iam in a city..I dont know about any free counsellors..How to find the info sys(Providing Suggestions, Question): are you near a public library? sometimes librarians are really helpful to find community information. you could call them. do you have a family doctor? usr: Oh I think we have a public library near to my houe..I can enquire about it sys(Providing Suggestions): or of course you could do a google search for counseling usr: sure..I can do that..thank you for your help..

I wish there were more opportunities or a way to find what I'm passionate about. sys(Question, Question): What kind of field of work are you hoping to get into What kind of work motivates you on a daily basis usr: I have been in pharmacy field but there's not a lot of jobs where I live. Trying to find something remote. But even if I find something it will probably be difficult to do for me long term Things that motivate me are organizing, exercising sys(Others): That sounds like a very promising line of work, have you thought about a fitness trainer or maybe a physical therapist that would go along with exercise usr: That would be good, but I am not the best at it. Just recreationally. It would also require school which is out of the picture right now sys(Providing Suggestions): There are alot of online courses that are affordable and even grants if you quailfy usr: That is true. I will look in to it. Maybe I could do my own thing too with organization. I am also moving at the moment, plus the pandemic so there are a lot of stressors. sys(Reflection of feelings, Others, Others): It sounds like you have a lot going on right now, but who mentioned organization was one of your strengths its the same as listing career posibilites and making a list of things to accomplish it I meant you mentioned lol I meant you mentioned lol usr: Yes good idea. I will work on that, making a list of what I would like to do and strengths. Just brainstorming. It takes a long time to figure it out and do the hiring process, or possibly going to school. It is a big decision sys(Affirmation and Reassurance): Yes I know it sounds really hard but I truly believe you can do it usr: Thank you! You have been helpful and motivating sys(Reflection of feelings): Well I am very glad I was able to help usr: I'll keep trying. I have a lot of time on my hands at the moment so I will put it to good use hopefully. Have a nice day!
label: ['Affirmation and Reassurance']

text: sys(Question): Hi, How are you? usr: I am the youngest of 5 siblings and I feel all most days now because of my parents
label: ['Restatement or Paraphrasing']

text: sys(Question): Hi, How are you? usr: I am the youngest of 5 siblings and I feel all most days now because of my parents sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): It sounds like you're having a hard time feeling like you have your parents' attention, is that right? usr: Not their attention, but more on their expectations on me
label: ['Reflection of feelings', 'Question']

text: sys(Question): Hi, How are you? usr: I am the youngest of 5 siblings and I feel all most days now because of my parents sys(Restatement or Paraphrasing): It sounds like you're having a hard time feeling like you have your parents' attention, is that right? usr: Not their attention, but more on their expectations on me sys(Reflection of feelings, Question): That sounds frustrating, I'm sorry Do they do or say anything specific that makes you feel those expectations? usr: Yes, its more on comparing me to the children of their friends. They always say why don't I have a better job or even plans on marrying rich. Stuff like that is very frustrating They also expect me to take care of them financially soon, I'm just starting my adult life I want to enjoy it
label: ['Reflection of feelings', 'Question']

My friend asked what is up and my girlfriend of course was nosey and said bad cuz my mom is harassing us. I was saying my mom has been ripping me off and keeps threatening to kick me out. So I just said. I honestly am at the point where I don't care if she is around or not. So someone reported me for some bs thing on playstation cuz they think I must be trash if I don't love my mom or something sys(Providing Suggestions): I see. If that is the case, create a personal meeting with you and your friends (the ones who banned you). usr: My mom is kind of a draining person. I thought of being around because she has been going through low hemoglobin. But she keeps ruining my life I wish I could. I don't even know the jerk The rest of them then did it because they don't like my girlfriend sys(Question): just to clarify, are these online friends? Have you met them in person? usr: Online friends I only know one the one who was on the phone with me he just can't keep a call private for anything sys(Question): and now for that one friend, does he know the other friends personally? usr: Even my nephew who plays with those jerks was avoiding me because my girlfriend. yeah... So... my girlfriend has this condition and was in a hospital for high contamination in her blood from her bad liver. So she was talking weird. and everyone was calling her annoying sys(Others): I'm sorry to hear that. usr: But those insensentive morons don't care she literally almost died. Instead, everyone just keeps asking why am I with this disabled girl Like... she is better now. She just needed to recover People I knew for four years... going out of their way to mess with me. sys(Providing Suggestions, Providing Suggestions): The best advice I can give you is to try to get your friends together on a private group call. Then tell them that what they've heard was a complete misunderstanding. And tell them to unban you from playstation. However, if they do not respect your response, then they can't really be relied on as your friends. They don't come to respect you so it is best for you to move on. usr: Yeah. I mostly tried to stay to my myself. Right now they're mad at me because they got all warnings from Sony since they did an investigation on how everyone speaks sys(Information): Nobody should demoralize another person and that is what your "online friends" are taking advantage of. usr: Even my own sister is giving me crap because my nephew almost lost thousands worth of games sys(Information): Also send a report to Sony about the ban. I believe with the proof, they can appeal the ban for you! usr: cuz of the warning... Like I can control what these people do when I'm offline. I did... they said they can't do anything and that I can just report them. Kind of sucks but I guess I will just stick my lane. Karma already banned someone in the group took $2000 worth of games so that gave me a good laugh sys(Providing Suggestions): In that case just keep reporting them. usr: I would but that would just get my nephew banned He still is at the point where he blames me it's crazy4 sys(Others): Ah I see! Don't get your nephew banned! usr: Yeah. He actually said he hates my guts and remove me from authorizing his games even though I paid for over 100 dollars of the content sys(Question): how close are you to your nephew? usr: Very. Which is why I am more angry That he is siding with people who disrespect me that much sys(Providing Suggestions): If he's relying on your payments for the content, then I suggest for you to stop the payments until he learns his lesson. usr: Well my friend just said it's my fault for buying ourselves game on his account sys(Providing Suggestions): He clearly does not respect you so you need to set up some discipline and ground rules. usr: that prick For now... I am just left on my own.
label: ['Others']
